answers.author: Emma Jurado
answers.text:
Below is some feedback on this topic from a very excellent expert. I hope it is helpful.
Santa Clarita – Council report re: WITHDRAW FROM THE COUNTY OF LOS ANGELES PUBLIC LIBRARY SYSTEM AND ESTABLISHMENT OF AN INDEPENDENT MUNICIPAL LIBRARY 
http://apps.santa-clarita.com/agendas/CouncilItemPrint.aspx?ID=5198 
Fillmore, CA – Council report re:  WITHDRAWAL FROM THE VENTURA COUNTY LIBRARY MEMORANDUM OF UNDERSTANDING AND SUBSEQUENT CONTINUED MEMBERSHIP IN THE VENTURA COUNTY LIBRARY SYSTEM
http://www.fillmoreca.com/docs/agendas/2011/4-26-11/4-26-11-7e.pdf 
Ventura, CA - Cities Withdraw from Ventura County’s Library System; Contract with Private Company
http://californiacitynews.typepad.com/california_county_news/2010/10/cities-withdraw-from-ventura-countys-library-system-contract-with-private-company.html 
MOTION BY SUPERVISOR MICHAEL D. ANTONOVICH MARCH 22, 2011 - AB 438 - COUNTY LIBRARY SYSTEM WITHDRAWAL 
http://file.lacounty.gov/bos/supdocs/59705.pdf 
CA AB 438 - County free libraries: withdrawal: use of private contractor
http://www.aroundthecapitol.com/Bills/AB_438/20112012/ 
Article - Don’t Privatize That Book! The Service Employees International Union tries to stop California cities from outsourcing library services. 9 June 2011
http://www.city-journal.org/2011/cjc0609mc.html 
Article – How to Start a Public Library – tips to get started
http://www.ehow.com/how_2107132_start-public-library.html

author: Pamela Muse
text:
A California member is interested in learning from other cities that have withdrawn from their County Library systems.  Copies of your Council Reports on this topic would be very beneficial.
Timing is an issue; any documentation you can provide ASAP is appreciated.
Pamela Muse
Western Regional Director
Alliance for Innovation
888-468-6450 Voice
480-231-3538 Text
pmuse@transformgov.org
title: City Withdrawal from County Library System
